sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with noisy data
message_1:
Consider the following system of linear equations with noisy data:

2x + 3y + 4z = 11.6  
3x + 2y + 5z = 14.2  
4x + 5y + 3z = 19.3  

Find the solution for this system of equations using the Gaussian elimination method. Round your answer to two decimal places.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using Gaussian elimination, we will perform row operations to transform the augmented matrix into an upper triangular matrix, and then use back-substitution to find the solution.

The augmented matrix is:

| 2  3  4 | 11.6 |
| 3  2  5 | 14.2 |
| 4  5  3 | 19.3 |

Step 1: Eliminate x from the second and third rows.

R2 = R2 - (3/2)R1
R3 = R3 - 2R1

| 2  3   4  | 11.6 |
| 0 -1.5  1  | -3.4 |
| 0 -1   -5  | -3.9 |

Step 2: Eliminate y from the third row.

R3 = R3 - (2/3)R2

|  2   3    4  | 11.6 |
|  0 -1.5  1   | -3.4 |
|  0   0  -4.33| -0.6 |

Step 3: Back-substitution

z = -0.6 / -4.33 ≈ 0.14
y = (-3.4 - 1 * 0.14) / -1.5 ≈ 2.36
x = (11.6 - 3 * 2.36 - 4 * 0.14) / 2 ≈ 1.07

So, the solution is approximately x = 1.07, y = 2.36, and z = 0.14.
